intro: Andreettaea delicatula, commonly known as the delicate andreettaea, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy areas, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a compact inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
